generif.text: a paper that firstly reported cloning of human TTP1 (PTOP) and its biological function at telomere. TPP1 interacts with both POT1 and TIN2, heterodimerizes with POT1 and regulates POT1 telomeric recruitment and telomere length.
TINT1 localized to telomeres via TIN2, where it functions as a negative regulator of telomerase-mediated telomere elongation.

Sequencing of ACD in 15 patients with clinical features of IMAGe syndrome, adrenal hypoplasia congenita, or congenital adrenal insufficiency revealed no coding mutations, but three novel SNPs were identified
coordinated interactions among TPP1, TIN2, TRF1, and TRF2 may ensure robust assembly of the telosome, telomere targeting of its subunits, and, ultimately, regulated telomere maintenance

findings highlight the critical role of TPP1 in telomere maintenance, and support a yin-yang model in which TPP1 and POT1 function as a unit to protect human telomeres, by both positively and negatively regulating telomerase access to telomere DNA

crystal structure of human TPP1 reveals an oligonucleotide/oligosaccharide-binding fold that is structurally similar to the beta-subunit of the telomere end-binding protein of a ciliated protozoan; TPP1 is the missing beta-subunit of human POT1
REVIEW:TPP1 as a critical mediator of control of telomerase activity

No mutations were identified in ACD in this collection of patients with ACTH resistance phenotypes. However, the newly identified SNPs in ACD should be more closely examined for possible links to disease.
Observational study of genotype prevalence. (HuGE Navigator)
Tpp1 is required for the protective function of Pot1 proteins.
Increased expression of TPP1 correlates with resistance to radiation in human laryngeal cancer cell lines.
Studies indicate that TPP1 and POT1can form heterodimers that bind to the telomeric single-stranded DNA, an activity that is central for telomere end capping.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
POT1-TPP1 enhances telomerase processivity by slowing primer dissociation and aiding translocation.
TIN2-anchored TPP1 plays a major role in the recruitment of telomerase to telomeres in human cells.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Mouse gene deletion experiments revealed DNA-damage-response pathways that threaten chromosome ends and how the components of the telomeric shelterin complex prevent activation of these pathways.[Shelterin]

The presence of dysfunctional telomeres in chronic lymphocytic leukemia did not correlate with telomere shortening or chromatin marks deregulation but with a down-regulation of 2 shelterin genes: ACD and TINF2.
Human telomere POT1-TPP1 complex and its role in telomerase activity regulation.
Multiple POT1-TPP1 proteins coat and compact long telomeric single-stranded DNA.
Human UPF1 interacts with TPP1 and telomerase and sustains telomere leading-strand replication.
Altered expression of TPP1 in fibroblast-like synovial cells might be involved in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis.

Study shows that the OB-fold domain of the telomere-binding protein TPP1 recruits telomerase to telomeres through an association with the telomerase reverse transcriptase TERT; data define a potential interface for telomerase-TPP1 interaction required for telomere maintenance and implicate defective telomerase recruitment in telomerase-related disease.
POT1-TPP1 regulates telomeric overhang structural dynamics.
The TEL patch of telomere protein TPP1 mediates telomerase recruitment and processivity.
Phosphorylation of TPP1 regulates cell cycle-dependent telomerase recruitment.
Coordinated interactions of multiple POT1-TPP1 proteins with telomere DNA.
Akt regulates TPP1 homodimerization and telomere protection.
Telomere-binding protein TPP1 modulates telomere homeostasis and confers radioresistance to human colorectal cancer cells.
Suppression of telomere-binding protein TPP1 resulted in telomere dysfunction and enhanced radiation sensitivity in telomerase-negative osteosarcoma cell line.
G-quadruplex formation in telomeres enhances POT1/TPP1 protection against RPA binding.
Shelterin protein TPP 1 interacts with hTERT and recruits hTERT onto the telomeres, suggesting that TPP 1 might be involved in regulation of telomere shortening.
Genetic and molecular identification of three human TPP1 functions in telomerase action: recruitment, activation, and homeostasis set point regulation.
The shelterin component TPP1 is a binding partner and substrate for the deubiquitinating enzyme USP7.
The data support a causal relationship between a TPP1 mutation and bone marrow disorders in a family.
Hoyeraal-Hreidarsson syndrome caused by a germline mutation in the TEL patch of the telomere protein TPP1.
Clustering of novel mutations in the POT1 binding domain of ACD was statistically higher (P = .005) in melanoma probands compared with population control individuals (n = 6785).
a novel ACD mutation(p.G223V)is detected; ACD is a novel gene involved in childhood pre-B acute lymphoblastic leukemia and may play a functional role in enhancing leukemia cell survival
Dissecting Fission Yeast Shelterin Interactions via MICro-MS Links Disruption of Shelterin Bridge to Tumorigenesis.
The Insertion in Fingers Domain in Human Telomerase Can Mediate Enzyme Processivity and Telomerase Recruitment to Telomeres in a TPP1-Dependent Manner.
POT1-TPP1 Binding and Unfolding of Telomere DNA Discriminates against Structural Polymorphism.
NEK6-mediated phosphorylation of human TPP1 regulates telomere length through telomerase recruitment.
Shelterin Telomere Protection Protein 1 Reduction Causes Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence via Sirtuin 1 Deacetylase in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.
Dynamic peptides of human TPP1 fulfill diverse functions in telomere maintenance.

We report the crystal structure of a mutant TPP1 implicated in dyskeratosis congenita (DC) to reveal how the mutation disrupts a region of the protein essential for telomerase function. Furthermore, we demonstrated that this mutation, when introduced into a human cell line, is sufficient to cause the cellular underpinnings of DC.
A defective POT1-TPP1 complex leads to longer and fragile telomeres, which in turn promotes genomic instability and cancer.
several missense mutations in human cancers that disrupt the POT1C-TPP1 interaction, resulting in POT1 instability, were identified.
show that TPP1 NOB is critical for telomerase function and demonstrate that the telomerase interaction surface on TPP1 is more elaborate than previously appreciated
Missense variant rs149418249 in the 11th exon of TPP1 (ACD) is significantly associated with colorectal cancer risk.
This study reports the first instance of homozygous TPP1 OB-fold variants in patients from 2 unrelated families who have overlapping phenotypes with dyskeratosis congenital.
is involved in glioblastoma radioresistance, likely through the modulation of telomerase activity, proliferation, and apoptosis.
shorter telomere length and downregulation of the major shelterin components TRF2 and TPP1 (ACD) leading to "telomere uncapping", might play a critical role in recurrent pregnancy loss.

Authors found that TPP1(ACD) upon binding to TIN2 induces changes that expand TIN2 binding capacity, such that TIN2 can accommodate both TRF1 and TRF2 simultaneously. Authors suggest a molecular model that explains why ACD is essential for the stable formation of TRF1-TIN2-TRF2 core complex.
Two Separation-of-Function Isoforms of Human TPP1 Dictate Telomerase Regulation in Somatic and Germ Cells.

All of the TIN2 isoforms stimulated telomerase to similar extents. Mutations in the TPP1 TEL patch abrogated this stimulation, suggesting that TIN2 functions with TPP1/POT1 to stimulate telomerase processivity.
Pulmonary fibrosis linked to variants in the ACD gene, encoding the telomere protein TPP1.

The assembly of telomere ssDNA substrates of differing lengths bound by POT1-TPP1 heterodimers was affected by a POT1 missense mutation.  There was a telomerase inhibitory role when several native POT1-TPP1 proteins coat physiologically relevant lengths of telomere ssDNA.
Shelterin and the replisome: at the intersection of telomere repair and replication.
Telomere length set point regulation in human pluripotent stem cells critically depends on the shelterin protein TPP1.
Constitutional variants in POT1, TERF2IP, and ACD genes in patients with melanoma in the Polish population.
Identification and characterization of novel ACD variants: modulation of TPP1 protein level offsets the impact of germline loss-of-function variants on telomere length.
Active and Passive Destabilization of G-Quadruplex DNA by the Telomere POT1-TPP1 Complex.
A Role for Human DNA Polymerase lambda in Alternative Lengthening of Telomeres.
TPP1 mutagenesis screens unravel shelterin interfaces and functions in hematopoiesis.
Multiple hPOT1-TPP1 cooperatively unfold contiguous telomeric G-quadruplexes proceeding from 3' toward 5', a feature due to a 3'-end binding preference and to structuring of telomeric DNA.
Structural basis of human telomerase recruitment by TPP1-POT1.
Structure of active human telomerase with telomere shelterin protein TPP1.
TPP1 promoter mutations cooperate with TERT promoter mutations to lengthen telomeres in melanoma.
Complex interaction network revealed by mutation of human telomerase 'insertion in fingers' and essential N-terminal domains and the telomere protein TPP1.
CTC1 OB-B interaction with TPP1 terminates telomerase and prevents telomere overextension.
Characterization of novel mutations in the TEL-patch domain of the telomeric factor TPP1 associated with telomere biology disorders.
TPP1 is associated with risk of advanced precursors and cervical cancer survival.

summary: This gene encodes a protein that is involved in telomere function. This protein is one of six core proteins in the telosome/shelterin telomeric complex, which functions to maintain telomere length and to protect telomere ends. Through its interaction with other components, this protein plays a key role in the assembly and stabilization of this complex, and it mediates the access of telomerase to the telomere. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. This gene, which is also referred to as TPP1, is distinct from the unrelated TPP1 gene on chromosome 11, which encodes tripeptidyl-peptidase I. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
